value.title: Brian Stelter, “Hoax: Donald Trump, Fox News, and the Dangerous Distortion of Truth”
value.excerpt: Brian Stelter, CNN chief media correspondent and anchor of “Reliable Sources,” crafted his book "Hoax: Donald Trump, Fox News, and the Dangerous Distortion of Truth” from three years of interviews with more than 300 current and former Fox News staffers.

value.title: Congress Ends Trump-Era Rule Enabling Payday Lenders to Avoid Interest Rate Caps
value.excerpt: An October ruling by the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency enabled high-interest consumer lenders to attach themselves to banks and circumvent state-level interest rate caps.

value.title: College won't revoke Trump adviser Flynn's honorary degree
value.excerpt: The University of Rhode Island has decided not to revoke an honorary degree bestowed upon Michael Flynn, an alumnus who briefly served as President Donald Trump’s national security adviser

value.title: Rudy Giuliani’s law license suspended over ‘false statements’ about Trump election loss
value.excerpt: Giuliani was the primary mouthpiece for Trump’s lies after the 2020 election, saying they would challenge what he claimed was a vast conspiracy by Democrats.

value.title: Rep. Gonzales on Kamala Harris' border trip: Trump put Biden admin in 'political vise'
value.excerpt: Texas, said Thursday that pressure from former President Donald Trump pushed Vice President Kamala Harris to announce that she would be visiting the border this week.

value.title: Trump ridicules Ducey over political future: 'There is no way he would get my endorsement'
value.excerpt: Without the former president's endorsement, Ducey's aspirations "would be permanently put to rest," Trump said.

value.title: Trump announces July 3 rally, fireworks show in Florida
value.excerpt: Former President Trump is ready for a holiday show. Trump’s Save America PAC will be holding a rally in Sarasota, Florida on July 3 that will include a speech from the 45th President.

value.title: Nearly 900 Secret Service members were infected with the coronavirus. A watchdog blames Trump.
value.excerpt: The nonprofit Citizens for Responsibility and Ethics in Washington published a report detailing how 881 Secret Service employees had tested positive between March 1, 2020, and March 9, 2021.

value.title: Trump Justice Department’s Leak Probe Wasn’t Aimed at Lawmakers
value.excerpt: Past and current officials say FBI obtained Democratic congressmen’s communications data because they were in contact with committee staffers under investigation for leaks about probe of Trump campaign’s ties to Russia.

value.title: Unholy post-Trump trinity: Bannon, Pompeo and Pence
value.excerpt: Catering to the white evangelicals and other conservative Christians may be good politics, but the approach Pence, Pompeo and other prominent Trumpites such as Steve Bannon take t

value.title: Michigan Republicans eviscerate Trump voter fraud claims in scathing report
value.excerpt: The report blasts "lies" and "outright deception" that formed the basis of many claims of election malfeasance in the state.

value.title: Michigan Republican-led investigation rejects Trump's claim that 2020 election was stolen
value.excerpt: The results of the Michigan Senate Oversight Committee's investigation into the election found no basis for a conspiracy to steal the election.

value.title: Chris Hayes: Red States Suffering From The Toxic Legacy Of Donald Trump
value.excerpt: We are seeing the effects of the toxic, devastating legacy of Donald Trump right now in the places that supported him the most,” MSNBC's Chris Hayes said Tuesday.

value.title: Ted Cruz defends Texas Rep. Chip Roy as Donald Trump attacks him
value.excerpt: Donald Trump may be gunning for Congressman Chip Roy, but U.S. Sen. Ted Cruz is making it clear he’s going to fight to defend Roy, his former chief of staff. A month after Trump publicly blasted Roy,

value.title: CNN's Don Lemon continues Trump rants more than two weeks straight after urging media to 'leave him alone'
value.excerpt: CNN anchor Don Lemon's advice to the media about finally letting go former President Trump has apparently fallen on his own deaf ears.

value.title: Leader behind bleach ‘miracle cure’ claims Trump consumed his product
value.excerpt: Mark Grenon says in interview from prison he gave Trump the product and was the source of Trump’s fixation with disinfectant

value.title: Greg Abbott's Border Wall Pushes Democrats and Activists to Stop Ignoring Trump
value.excerpt: Many in politics are happy to ignore former president Donald Trump now that he has been banished from most social media networks, but his return to the Texas border June 30 has led Latino groups and activists to mobilize against him once again.

value.title: Trump has ‘zero desire’ to be speaker of House, spokesman says
value.excerpt: Chatter about the most unlikely of political comebacks has spread among Trump supporters

value.title: Trump supporters discussed ‘revolution’ ahead of Capitol riot, FBI agent says
value.excerpt: According to a court filing from an FBI agent obtained by NBC News, Trump supporters were discussing “revolution” on social media ahead of the January 6th Capitol riot, contrasting how FBI Director Christopher Wray portrayed the agency’s intelligence.

value.title: Judge dismisses most claims against Trump administration in clearing of Lafayette Square
value.excerpt: Activists and civil liberties groups accused Trump of violating the civil rights of protesters who were removed from the park near the White House.

value.title: New York Times’ scribe Maggie Haberman can’t quit Trump, largely ignores Biden
value.excerpt: New York Times reporter Maggie Haberman serves as a Washington correspondent for the liberal newspaper, but she appears far more focused on the last White House occupant than the current one.

value.title: DeSantis edges out Trump in 2024 straw poll, Tucker Carlson rules out bid
value.excerpt: Ron DeSantis, who has endeared himself to conservatives for bucking coronavirus restrictions and lockdowns, and combating critical race theory, hasn’t said he would mount a campaign in 2024.

value.title: Trump proposed sending Americans with Covid to Guantánamo, book claims
value.excerpt: Stunning revelation contained in new book Nightmare Scenario by Washington Post reporters Yasmeen Abutaleb and Damian Paletta

value.title: Trump and his CFO Allen Weisselberg stay close as prosecutors advance their case
value.excerpt: The former president and his trusted lieutenant both head to Trump Tower as prosecutors press Allen Weisselberg to turn on his boss.

value.title: Trump wishes a happy Father’s Day to ‘losers’ and ‘RINOs’
value.excerpt: Former President Donald Trump on Sunday sent a Father’s Day message to his political adversaries — who he blasted as “losers.”

value.title: Officials make more progress in restoring Iranian nuclear agreement given up by Trump administration
value.excerpt: Progress has been made at talks between Iran and global powers to try to restore a landmark 2015 agreement to contain Iranian nuclear development.

value.title: Trump cowboy seeks political comeback after Capitol riot
value.excerpt: Couy Griffin is divorced, disparaged by family and confronts a political recall drive, a state corruption investigation and federal charges. And yet he sees himself as governor one day.

value.title: QAnon Supporters Dismayed at Donald Trump's December Tour With Bill O'Reilly
value.excerpt: The conspiracy theorists come to the realization that Trump will not be president by end of the year if he is touring the country with former Fox News host.

value.title: Trump backs challenger to GOP Sen. Lisa Murkowski, who voted to convict him in second impeachment trial
value.excerpt: In a statement, Trump threw his support behind Kelly Tshibaka, the former state commissioner of administration, calling Murkowski "bad for Alaska."

value.title: Trump supporter sues town for $25M: ‘They’re trying to silence me’
value.excerpt: Michael Wasserman wants to let his freedom fly — but his town of Long Beach, LI, isn’t having it. “I believe the city is trying to silence me because I’m pro-Trump,” he told The Post. The
